edu.umn.biomedicus.measures

Class UnitRecognizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umn.biomedicus.measures.UnitRecognizer

  • public class UnitRecognizer
extends Object
    Recognizes token sequences that are units of measure. Maps the units of measure to their Unified Code of Units of Measurement code. This class is currently untested and not stable.
    Usage: 
       
for(String word : sentence) {
  Optional<Result> potentialResult = unitRecognizer.advance(word, index, index + word.length());
  if (potentialResult.isPresent()) {
    Result result = potentialResult.get();
    // do stuff with result.
  }
  index += word.length();
}
Optional<Result> potentialResult = unitRecognizer.finish();
if (potentialResult.isPresent()) {
  Result result = potentialResult.get();
  int begin = result.getBegin();
  int end = result.getEnd();
}

    It is not safe to use an instance of this class from multiple threads at once, use multiple instances for concurrency.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  UnitRecognizer.Factory
      A factory class that can be used to provided multiple independent unit of measure recognizers.
      static class  UnitRecognizer.Result
      The result when the unit detector finds a unit.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UnitRecognizer

        public UnitRecognizer(Map<String,String> unitOfMeasureMap)
        Constructs a units recognizer.
        Parameters:
        unitOfMeasureMap - a map from units to their UCUM code.

    • Method Detail

      • inProgress

        public boolean inProgress()
        Whether or not the unit recognizer has begun recognizing a unit.
        Returns:
        true if it has begun, false otherwise

      • advance

        public Optional<UnitRecognizer.Result> advance(CharSequence token,
                                               int begin,
                                               int end)
        Advances the recognizer, detecting if tokens passed to it have any units of measurement.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to pass, should already be lowercased
        begin - the begin index of the token
        end - the end index of the token
        Returns:
        an optional result will be present when a unit of measurement was detected.

      • advanceLowercased

        public Optional<UnitRecognizer.Result> advanceLowercased(String token,
                                                         int begin,
                                                         int end)
        Advances the recognizer, detecting if tokens passed to it have any units of measurement. This version of the advance(CharSequence, int, int) expects tokens to have been previously converted to lowercase.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to pass, should already be lowercased
        begin - the begin index of the token
        end - the end index of the token
        Returns:
        an optional result will be present when a unit of measurement was detected.

      • finish

        public Optional<UnitRecognizer.Result> finish()
        Tests the tokens that have been passed to the recognizer and are in progress.
        Returns:
        an optional result will be present when a unit of measurement was detected.

      • isUnitOfMeasureWord

        public boolean isUnitOfMeasureWord(String string)
        A simple test to determine if the string/word/token is a unit of measurement.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to test
        Returns:
        true if the string is a unit of measurement, false if it is not

      • isUnitOfMeasureWordLowercased

        public boolean isUnitOfMeasureWordLowercased(String lowercase)
        A simple test to determine if the string/word/token is a unit of measurement. This version of isUnitOfMeasureWord(String) expects the word to have already been converted to a lowercase format.
        Parameters:
        lowercase - the lowercased version of the string to test.
        Returns:
        true if the string is a unit of measurement, false if it is not.

      • createFactory

        public static UnitRecognizer.Factory createFactory(Path unitsOfMeasureFile)
                                            throws IOException
        Creates a UnitRecognizer.Factory to create new Unit Recognizers, loading data from the file at the specified path.
        Parameters:
        unitsOfMeasureFile - file to load units of measure and their codes from
        Returns:
        factory object used to create unit recognizers
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error loading the factory

      • createFactory

        public static UnitRecognizer.Factory createFactory()
                                            throws IOException
        Creates a UnitRecognizer.Factory, loading the units and subjects from their default files.
        Returns:
        newly initialized factory
        Throws:
        IOException - if the data fails to load.
